name: big cuff hat
sizes_available: baby (toddler, kid, adult small, adult large)
notes:
materials

- 1 (2, 2, 2, 3) ball(s) of purl soho’s [paintbrush mohair][1], 75% kid mohair and 25% peruvian pima cotton. each ball of this worsted/aran to chunky/bulky-weight yarn is 120 yards/ 50 grams; approximately 110 (155, 195, 235, 310) total yards required. we used the colors golden honey, golden raisin, fresh grapefruit, and giant sequoia.
- us 5 (3.75 mm), 12- or 16-inch [circular knitting needles][2] or us 5, 32-inch circular needles for [magic loop][3]
- if using 12- or 16-inch circular needles: a set of us 5 [double pointed needles][4]
- [removable stitch markers][5], including one unique

gauge
21 stitches and 27 rounds = 4 inches in stockinette stitch

sizes
for help choosing a hat size, check out our complete guide on [how to knit the right hat size][6]!

baby (toddler, kid, adult small, adult large)

to fit head circumference of 13½–15 (15–17, 17–19½, 19½–22, 22–25) inches

- finished circumference: 12¼ (13¾, 15¼, 17½, 19¾) inches
- finished height (cuffed): 6¼ (7¼, 8½, 8¾,10½) inches tall, with 3 (3¾, 4¼, 4½, 5¼) inch cuff
- finished height (uncuffed): 12¼ (14¾, 17, 17¾, 21) inches

samples: the golden honey hat is the baby size; the golden raisin hat is the kid size; and the fresh grapefruit and giant sequoia hats are the adult small size.

pattern designed and written by purl soho designer, [hiromi glover][7]. see even more of hiromi’s work [on her instagram][8]!
